subdivision_of_building: Land to the side and rear of the existing building on site.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Planning Statement; Design & Access Statement; Flood Risk Statement; Cold Room Condenser Information; Location Plan; Site Location Plan; Block Plan; PR 001 Rev D; PR 002 Rev A.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The operator of the public house shall adhere to the Noise Control Policy submitted, unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason: In the interests of neighbour amenity and to comply with Policy DM D2 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021.
Condition : 5 - Restriction on Music/Amplified Sound - No music or other amplified sound shall be generated in the outdoor pergola seating area hereby permitted.
Condition : 6 - Hours of Use - The use of the outdoor seating area in the pergola hereby permitted shall only be used between the hours of 08:00am to 23:00pm on any day.

Condition : 7 - Screening - The screening or enclosure to the pergola hereby permitted as shown on the approved plans shall be implemented before the development is first occupied and retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

Reason : 1 - The proposed works to create two new outdoor pergolas and a fixed outdoor seating area for the public house for patrons would result in noise disturbance to the occupants of the nearby residential properties and their rear gardens to the detriment of their amenity and enjoyment of their gardens. As such the proposal would fail to comply with Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM D2 of the Merton Site and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
description: EXTERNAL WORKS INCLUDING THE ERECTION OF 2 X PERGOLAS FOR ADDITIONAL OUTDOOR SEATING, A NEW WALK-IN FRIDGE/FREEZER AND A DEDICATED BIN STORE WITHIN THE EXISTING SERVICE YARD.
